name: Robbie Sherre
title: Senior React & Epic MyChart Engineer | AI Chat Interfaces • SMART on FHIR • Patient-Facing Platforms
summary: Senior Epic MyChart focused front-end engineer and application specialist with 10+ years of experience delivering patient-facing digital solutions across large healthcare systems. Combines deep knowledge of Epic MyChart workflows, mobile capabilities, and patient engagement architecture with modern front-end engineering expertise in React 19, Vue, and AI-driven interfaces. Experienced building chat-based assistants, SMART on FHIR applications, and scalable component systems aligned to healthcare security, accessibility, and performance standards. Proven ability to translate clinical and operational requirements into reliable, user-friendly web solutions while collaborating across analysts, architects, and engineering teams.
highlights: Epic MyChart & Patient Experience Platforms
SMART on FHIR / OAuth2 PKCE
React 19 & Enterprise Component Systems
AI Chat Interfaces & LLM Integration
FHIR R4 API Integration
Redux Toolkit / Context / Pinia
Healthcare Accessibility & Compliance
Mobile-First Healthcare UX
CI/CD & Containerized Delivery
Cross-Functional Clinical Collaboration

roles.title: Epic Application Analyst – MyChart, Patient Experience & Web Integrations
highlights: Led design and implementation of patient-facing Epic MyChart workflows supporting scheduling, messaging, and digital care pathways across multiple specialties.
Configured MyChart scheduling logic, visit types, provider templates, and portal navigation to improve patient access and workflow reliability.
Designed specialist e-Consult workflows using SmartForms, SmartTexts, routing logic, and billing automation triggers ensuring compliant documentation and CPT accuracy.
Built SMART on FHIR web applications launched from Epic using OAuth2 PKCE authentication and secure clinical context handling.
Worked across DEV / TST / PRD environments executing governed deployments using Strings Manager, Kuiper, KDiff, and ServiceNow.
Collaborated with interoperability, clinical, and infrastructure teams to diagnose workflow failures impacting patient journeys across scheduling, documentation, and billing.
Delivered modern web-based extensions that improved usability, reliability, and operational efficiency across Kaiser’s enterprise Epic platform.

roles.title: Front-End Developer – Enterprise Web & Patient Experience Platforms
highlights: Developed and maintained Kaiser Permanente’s enterprise healthcare web platform spanning 500+ sites across AEM and WordPress MU.
Built reusable UI components and design system patterns supporting scalable patient-facing experiences.
Partnered with UX, marketing, and clinical stakeholders to improve navigation, accessibility, and engagement across digital healthcare properties.
Contributed to MyChart-related initiatives focused on portal UI alignment, localization, and cross-platform experience consistency.
Improved deployment governance and content workflows, enabling faster rollout of standardized patient-facing experiences.

roles.title: Senior Front-End & Healthcare Application Engineer
highlights: Developed enterprise healthcare-focused web applications combining modern front-end engineering with AI-assisted workflows and clinical integrations.
Built Vue and React SMART on FHIR demonstration applications showcasing patient-facing clinical data views powered by FHIR R4 APIs and secure OAuth2 launch flows.
Worked under NDA on clinician-focused chatbot and voice-assistant application supporting workflow navigation and clinical information retrieval.
Delivered modular UI systems, automated build pipelines, and optimized deployment workflows supporting scalable healthcare application delivery.
Published portfolio demos illustrating production-ready Epic-integrated application architecture.

projects.name: Vue SMART on FHIR Starter
projects.description: Patient-facing SMART on FHIR demo showing secure launch, OAuth2 PKCE flow, and real-time clinical data retrieval using Vue 3.

projects.name: React SMART on FHIR Demo
projects.description: React-based Epic-launchable healthcare app demonstrating FHIR data rendering and modern patient-facing UI architecture.

certifications: Target: Epic MyChart Certification (within 3 months of hire)
